channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech

item.title: What really happens on the dark web, and how to stay safe
item.description: Cybersecurity expert shares six essential steps to protect against dark web threats, including data removal services, password managers and antivirus software.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Another major WordPress add-on security flaw could affect 10,000 sites - find out if you're affected
item.description: King Addons for Elementor allowed full WordPress website takeover through two critical-level vulnerabilities.
item.dc:creator: Sead Fadilpašić, TechRadar

item.title: What is Skylight? Here’s what you need to know about the TikTok alternative
item.description: The current king of social media is the short-form video platform TikTok. It’s where trends are forged, news is broken, and opinions spread.
item.dc:creator: Michael Grothaus, Fast Company

item.title: How to watch Brighton vs Leeds: Premier League 2025/26 streams, TV channels, kick-off time
item.description: We'll show you all the ways you can watch Brighton vs Leeds in the 2025/26 Premier League as Georginio Rutter faces his former club for the first time since departing last season.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Jones, TechRadar

item.title: How to watch Autumn Internationals 2025: Live stream rugby union for FREE, fixture list, preview
item.description: All the ways to watch Autumn Internationals 2025 live streams online from anywhere for FREE, as rugby union's biggest sides from both hemispheres clash.
item.dc:creator: Andy Murray, TechRadar

item.title: AI buildout cements its role as a global catalyst this week
item.description: A momentous week in the technology sector made it clear there is no sign the boom in building artificial intelligence infrastructure is slowing — despite the bubble talk. Nvidia, whose processors are the AI revolution’s backbone, became the first company to surpass $5 trillion in market value.
item.dc:creator: Reuters, Fast Company

item.title: Amazon carries Wall Street to the finish of another winning week and month
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Amazon led the U.S. stock market on Friday to the finish of another winning week and month. The S&P 500 rose 0.3% and pulled closer to its all-time high set on Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: STAN CHOE, Associated Press, The Hill

item.title: Nearly 58 billion personal data points have been leaked online since 2004, new study reveals
item.description: Your digital life is more exposed than you think. A new study from security firm Surfshark has quantified the astonishing scale of data breaches since 2004, revealing that tens of billions of personal data points, from passwords to physical addresses, are now in the wild.
item.dc:creator: Rene Millman, TechRadar

item.title: Gartner: AI budgets are going to projects that demonstrate value, real-world impact
item.description: Many infrastructure and operations leaders aren’t able to dig out enough money from budgets to reallocate to AI projects, Gartner said in a survey released this week. The research firm surveyed 253 IT leaders globally, and the budget issue plagued half the participants.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: China ranks last in VPN adoption globally - but it may all be smoke and mirrors
item.description: New research on VPN adoption reveals that China ranks last, but only in terms of downloads from Apple App Store and Google Play Store
item.dc:creator: Silvia Iacovcich, TechRadar

item.title: AI systems will learn bad behavior to meet performance goals, suggest researchers
item.description: There are plenty of stories out there about how politicians, sales representatives, and influencers, will exaggerate or distort the facts in order to win votes, sales, or clicks, even when they know they shouldn’t. It turns out that AI models, too, can suffer from these decidedly human failings.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: New LinkedIn phishing scam targets executives with fake board positions
item.description: No, you're not being invited to invest in South American businesses, you're being scammed into handing over Microsoft login credentials.
item.dc:creator: Sead Fadilpašić, TechRadar

item.title: Meta defies AI spending gloom with record-breaking bond sale
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc. found record-shattering demand for its bond sale on Thursday even as its shares plunged, in a sign that bond investors are looking past any concerns about its artificial-intelligence spending plans.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg, The Mercury News

item.title: It was the hottest thing in climate tech. Now it’s trapped in the valley of death
item.description: A year ago, direct air capture—technology that pulls CO2 from the air—seemed ready to quickly scale in the U.S. Project Cypress, a massive undertaking in Louisiana designed to capture more than a million tons of CO2 each year, won $50 million in funding from the Department of Energy in early 2024.
item.dc:creator: Adele Peters, Fast Company

item.title: AMD has ended support for RX 6000 GPUs – here's why it's a massive blunder in the battle against Nvidia
item.description: In a baffling move, AMD ends support for relatively recent RX 6000 GPUs – and gamers are up in arms (myself included).
item.dc:creator: Darren Allan, TechRadar

item.title: YouTube TV just dropped over 20 Disney channels – here's where to watch them instead
item.description: As the YouTube TV and Disney Channel deal breaks down, over 20 channels are now missing – but there's still places to watch them.
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Valentine, TechRadar

item.title: Chinese state hackers may be using VMWare Tools flaw to hack US systems - so patch now, CISA warns
item.description: A recently patched Broadcom flaw was added to CISA's KEV, warning FCEB agencies about abuse in the wild.
item.dc:creator: Sead Fadilpašić, TechRadar

item.title: The real reason your AI isn’t delivering ROI – and how to fix it
item.description: Over the last few years, the enterprise AI mandate has revolved around one question: “What can AI do?” That curiosity sparked a wave of pilots – creative, varied, and sometimes downright whimsical. Each offered lessons that deepened understanding of AI’s potential and limits.
item.dc:creator: CIO

item.title: The AI-native enterprise: The next wave of AI is about operations, not experiments
item.description: The past few years have seen an explosion of AI adoption across industries and enterprises. The innovators and early adopters led the charge, experimenting boldly, learning quickly, and accepting failure as part of the journey. Their primary goal was to see, stretch, and understand what AI could do.
item.dc:creator: CIO

item.title: Disney pulls ABC, ESPN and more from YouTube TV as talks break down
item.description: YouTube TV viewers have lost access to Disney channels, including ABC and ESPN, after contract talks broke down.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: OpenAI’s Atlas ushers in the era of AI browsing. Here’s what it means for media
item.description: For the past 30 years, the web browser has been the primary way humans navigate the internet. It makes sense, then, that as artificial intelligence becomes more humanlike in its capabilities, it would use the same tool.
item.dc:creator: Pete Pachal, Fast Company

item.title: Rust 1.91 promotes Windows on Arm64 to Tier 1 target
item.description: The Rust Release Team has released Rust 1.91, an update of the popular memory-safe programming language that promotes Windows on Arm64 platform to a Tier 1 supported target. Rust 1.91 was announced October 30. Previous users can upgrade by running rustup update stable.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Nvidia GTC news you need to know
item.description: Nvidia showcased a variety of advances at its GTC event (GPU Technology Conference) this week – everything from quantum computing inroads to a 6G wireless stack and improved partnerships with core vendors, including Cisco.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Young T. rex or a new dinosaur? New bones add to the debate
item.description: Scientists say there’s new evidence that settles the origins of a mysterious dinosaur excavated in the 1940s.
item.dc:creator: Adithi Ramakrishnan, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Jamf goes private in $2.2B deal as Apple hits the enterprise
item.description: The word that Jamf will go private in a $2.2 billion acquisition by Francisco Partners has surprised many in the Apple admin community. Jamf sasy the plan will accelerate growth, bolster its expansion and strengthen its market leadership.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Universal Music and AI song tool Udio settle lawsuit and partner on new platform, sparking backlash
item.description: LONDON (AP) — Universal Music Group and AI song generation platform Udio have settled a copyright infringement lawsuit and agreed to team up on new music creation and streaming platform, the two companies said in a joint announcement.
item.dc:creator: KELVIN CHAN, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Mistake-filled legal briefs show the limits of relying on AI tools at work
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Judges around the world are dealing with a growing problem: legal briefs that were generated with the help of artificial intelligence and submitted with errors such as citations to cases that don’t exist, according to attorneys and court documents.
item.dc:creator: CATHY BUSSEWITZ, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Trump, Xi didn't discuss Taiwan, Russian oil nor Blackwell chips
item.description: President Trump said the issues of Taiwan, Russian oil and Nvidia's advanced Blackwell chip weren't raised during his wide-ranging meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping in South Korea on Thursday. “Taiwan never came up.
item.dc:creator: Julia Manchester, The Hill

item.title: Windows 11: A guide to the updates
item.description: A Windows launch isn’t the end a process — it’s really just the beginning. Microsoft continually works on improving Windows 11 by fixing bugs, releasing security patches, and occasionally adding new features.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Microsoft deploys a fix to Azure cloud service that's hit with outage
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Microsoft has deployed a fix to address an outage of their Azure cloud portal that left users unable to access Office 365, Minecraft and other services.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Character.AI is banning minors from interacting with its chatbots
item.description: Character.AI is banning minors from using its chatbots amid growing concerns about the effects of artificial intelligence conversations on children.
item.dc:creator: BARBARA ORTUTAY, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Phony AI-generated videos of Hurricane Melissa flood social media sites
item.description: One viral video shows what appears to be four sharks swimming in a Jamaican hotel's pool as floodwaters allegedly brought on by Hurricane Melissa swamp the area. Another purportedly depicts Jamaica's Kingston airport completely ravaged by the storm.
item.dc:creator: TAIMOOR SOBHAN and KELVIN CHAN, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Cisco, Nvidia strengthen AI ties with new data center switch, reference architectures
item.description: Cisco and Nvidia are ramping up their partnership, and the latest deliverables include the new Cisco N9100 series data center switch built on Nvidia’s Spectrum-X Ethernet switch silicon.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: The quiet glory of REST and JSON
item.description: I don’t expect that many developers today fully appreciate the quiet glory that is REST and JSON. But then, most developers today have not been around the software business as long as I have. It’s only natural that we old timers have a clearer idea of how incredibly far the technology has come.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Nvidia looks to power AI factory networks
item.description: Networking technology took center stage at Nvidia’s GTC DC developers show in Washington, D.C. as a range of networking products were introduced for high-performance AI inference processing and more.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Stragglers from Myanmar scam center raided by army cross into Thailand as buildings are blown up
item.description: BANGKOK (AP) — The number of people fleeing from Myanmar to Thailand after Myanmar’s military shut down a major online scam center has slowed to a trickle, a Thai regional army commander said Tuesday, after more than 1,500 had left in the past week.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: 2025 global network outage report and internet health check
item.description: The reliability of services delivered by ISPs, cloud providers and conferencing services is critical for enterprise organizations.
item.dc:creator: Network World
